subject: Re: Vam

conversations.body_text: Hi Claudio Kambara,    Do you already have the Pro pedals and then separately purchased the PlusX controller and VAM Pro motor? Please use the Offset function in the top right corner of the SIMSONN Manager 2.0.8 software to perform a factory reset, ensuring the pedal signal starts from 0%. After that, proceed with calibration.  Also, are you using SimHub version 9.9.3? It supports over 100 racing games. Our upcoming 2.0.9 version will add support for Automobilista 2. We recommend using SimHub for now. Please remember not to run SimHub and SIMSONN Manager at the same time, as they will conflict with each other.  One more thing—what wheelbase are you using? Have you implemented EMI shielding or grounding, such as connecting the wheelbase shell to the PC case ground? This can effectively reduce interference issues.             https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

合并来自工单1320  
      主题: Funcionamento do disposto vam!  
      描述:  Good morning! I recently purchased the VAM device for the Pro pedals and I had difficulty configuring them! iRacing did not work in Automobilista 2, it works with a large delay in Assertto Corsa Competizuone, it worked and then stopped! I have already plugged it into a separate outlet thinking it could be force, but it continued the same thing! Sometimes the vibration goes off, sometimes the accelerator locks up and it gets to the point of misconfiguring the steering wheel and pedals in the games! I need help Enviado do meu iPhone
ID 为 1320 的工单已合并到此工单。

Yes, the pedals were purchased separately, first the pedals, then the VAM! I believe it came with the Plus X controller, it has an input for the VAM! I need to confirm that there really isn't another type of controller? Regarding the software, I'll try to return to the factory offset. As for Simhub, I really didn't know about the existence of the program. I'll try it as soon as I get home and check if the oscillation to ground is there either! Thanks for your attention.
Enviado do meu iPhone

Em 8 de jul. de 2025, à(s) 09:08, service@simsonn.com escreveu:

﻿
Hi Claudio Kambara,

Do you already have the Pro pedals and then separately purchased the PlusX controller and VAM Pro motor?
Please use the Offset function in the top right corner of the SIMSONN Manager 2.0.8 software to perform a factory reset, ensuring the pedal signal starts from 0%. After that, proceed with calibration.
Also, are you using SimHub version 9.9.3? It supports over 100 racing games. Our upcoming 2.0.9 version will add support for Automobilista 2.
We recommend using SimHub for now. Please remember not to run SimHub and SIMSONN Manager at the same time, as they will conflict with each other.
One more thing—what wheelbase are you using? Have you implemented EMI shielding or grounding, such as connecting the wheelbase shell to the PC case ground? This can effectively reduce interference issues.



https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Good morning! Yesterday I downloaded the Sim Hub program and had an exodus to run it on iRacing. It worked perfectly during the first lap, after that there were vibrations and the accelerator jammed to the point where I couldn't stop it from working on the computer! I unplugged it and after turning it on again it was no longer responding! Could it have burned out or is there any other way to solve this?
Enviado do meu iPhone

As for Simhub, I really didn't know about the existence of the program. I'll try it as soon as I get home and check if the oscillation to ground is there either! Thanks for your attention.
Enviado do meu iPhone

﻿
Hi Claudio Kambara,

Do you already have the Pro pedals and then separately purchased the PlusX controller and VAM Pro motor?
Please use the Offset function in the top right corner of the SIMSONN Manager 2.0.8 software to perform a factory reset, ensuring the pedal signal starts from 0%. After that, proceed with calibration.
Also, are you using SimHub version 9.9.3? It supports over 100 racing games. Our upcoming 2.0.9 version will add support for Automobilista 2.
We recommend using SimHub for now. Please remember not to run SimHub and SIMSONN Manager at the same time, as they will conflict with each other.
One more thing—what wheelbase are you using? Have you implemented EMI shielding or grounding, such as connecting the wheelbase shell to the PC case ground? This can effectively reduce interference issues.



https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi Claudio Kambara,    Please try swapping the ports to test the VAM motors and identify which one is faulty. This will help confirm that the controller itself is working properly. Once confirmed, we will send you a replacement VAM motor.     Additionally, please note that the controller does not limit motor power output by default—running at 100% force can damage the motor. We recommend setting the force limit to 50% and not exceeding 70%. The VAM Pro motors do not have this issue.
Hi Claudio Kambara,    What do you mean by “throttle locked”? When the throttle is locked, are you still able to press the brake pedal? Could you please install Todesk so I can check remotely?
Hi Claudio Kambara,  https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

Hi Claudio Kambara,  Regarding the acceleration issue, you need to set a 5% dead zone for the throttle, and possibly for the other pedals as well. Otherwise, the pedals may be overly sensitive.      After the final remote session and confirmation, we will send you a replacement VAM motor. Please also make sure to apply the previously mentioned settings before use.

Hi Claudio Kambara,  What is your order number for the pedals and VAM? Please take photos of the pedals, VAM, and the control box wiring, and we will check them and get back to you.

Hi Claudio Kambara,    First, please make sure your software is updated to the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 and that the pedal firmware is also up to date. If both are already updated, the issue may be caused by unstable USB power supply or EMI interference from the wheelbase.  Please connect the pedal’s USB cable directly to the blue USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC and avoid using a USB hub to ensure stable power. Additionally, if the wheelbase and PC are using a two-prong power plug, it may result in poor grounding, or the wall socket itself might lack proper grounding. You can refer to the following steps for troubleshooting.       To address EMI (Electromagnetic Interference) issues, please follow the steps below to improve device stability and USB connection reliability:     1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding.     2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive.     3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup.     4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.     5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.     6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference.     7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements.     8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.     Among them, connecting the green wire between the control unit and the pedal’s metal screw, and using a USB isolator, are effective methods. Most importantly, ensure that the computer uses a three-prong power plug and that the wall socket has a valid ground connection, as this can directly eliminate all interference issues.

Em 28 de jul. de 2025, à(s) 11:10, service@simsonn.com escreveu:

﻿
Hi Claudio Kambara,

First, please make sure your software is updated to the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 and that the pedal firmware is also up to date.
If both are already updated, the issue may be caused by unstable USB power supply or EMI interference from the wheelbase.
Please connect the pedal’s USB cable directly to the blue USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC and avoid using a USB hub to ensure stable power.
Additionally, if the wheelbase and PC are using a two-prong power plug, it may result in poor grounding, or the wall socket itself might lack proper grounding.
You can refer to the following steps for troubleshooting.

To address EMI (Electromagnetic Interference) issues, please follow the steps below to improve device stability and USB connection reliability:
    1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding.
    2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive.
    3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup.
    4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.
    5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.
    6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference.
    7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements.
    8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.

Among them, connecting the green wire between the control unit and the pedal’s metal screw, and using a USB isolator, are effective methods.
Most importantly, ensure that the computer uses a three-prong power plug and that the wall socket has a valid ground connection, as this can directly eliminate all interference issues.

Hi Claudio Kambara,  Please release the upgrade button on the control box and reconnect the USB. This will exit the upgrade mode and switch the device back to normal operation mode.

Hi Claudio Kambara，  Please provide photos of your pedal installation from the front, back, left, and right, along with photos of the motor, bracket, and computer power plug.  These will allow me to analyze the issue, as it is difficult to resolve EMI interference problems based on text descriptions alone.

Hi Claudio Kambara,    Has the device been recognized now? In SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0, I saw the photos provided in ticket #2071, showing that the Toyota color can be changed and the device has already exited upgrade mode and entered normal operation. Are you still experiencing any other issues?

Hi Claudio Kambara,  We have also noticed this issue during our lab tests, and we will release an update in the coming days to fix it. At that time, you can go to Settings → Update → Check for updates to install the 2.1.1 software version, and then check for updates again to be prompted for a firmware upgrade. This should resolve the problem.
Hi Claudio Kambara,  In addition, please do not run SimHub and Simsonn Manager at the same time.
